discussion.content:
Dashboards are built with source reports, filters, and components.

Source reports are reports that provide data for components. Each component has one source report. Different components can have different source reports. The fields available for dashboard filters are the fields available in the objects that source reports are based on. Create source reports in the Report Builder.

Filters let dashboard readers scope the data they see in the dashboard to a particular view.

Components are the visual “blocks” of a dashboard. Each component is either a chart, gauge, metric, or table.

Permission sets can replace the need for profiles.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
False
Essentially, a user's profile is the baseline authorization of access to the Org. Permission sets are, as the name implies, a set of additional CRED permissions that can be applied to different profiles. Typically they are task-based and related to different Objects and managed packages.

FALSE- Permission sets cannot replace the need for profiles. Permission sets are used to grant additional permissions to users beyond what their profile allows, but they do not define the basic level of access that profiles provide. Profiles still define the core permissions for a user, and permission sets are used to supplement those permissions as needed.
Picklist can allow upto 1000 values and multi picklist will allow 500 values. so Answer is D
If they are referring to a standard picklist the answer would be 500. 1000 is custom picklist values. I will considerer standard.

You can have up to 500 picklist global value sets in an org. Each global value set, or restricted picklist, can contain a mix of 1,000 active and inactive values. Unrestricted picklists can have up to 1,000 active values. There’s no limit on the number of custom picklists that use global picklist value sets. If you apply a global picklist value set to more than 13 different objects, you can deactivate values from the picklist value set, but you can’t delete any values from the set.
